# Contributing

## Getting Started

If you're looking to contribute, check out the codebase and follow the development setup in the README.

## Working on the CMS

First you'll need to fork this repository to your personal Github account, then clone it locally.

### Setup

```bash
yarn setup
yarn dev
```

### Branching Guide

`main` always contains the latest changes. Stable versions are tagged using semantic versioning.

Work on a branch to make keeping up-to-date and submitting pull requests easier.

### Commit Messages

- **1st line:** Max 80 character summary in past tense
- **2nd line:** [Always blank]
- **3rd line:** Issue reference if applicable
- **4th line:** Context - why this change was made

### Submitting Pull Requests

Please provide context and reasoning around your changes. If your PR gets out of date, you may be asked to rebase.
